Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery oinochoe; interior: glazed black (fired brown) on neck, reserved below; exterior: black with narrow band in added red on neck; below, black-figure decoration consisting of warrior to left (helmeted head with red, part of round shield, and part of spear remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p, 40, pl. XX, no. 23)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 310, no. B323)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1217)
